moves.1. f4: So here's a game where i really struggled to win. I go down in material quite a bit, but through a blunder from my opponent i manage to win it. So he kick off with f4, which is rather odd opening.
moves.1... d5 2. Nf3 g6: i decided to go with the kings Indian
moves.3. e3 Nf6 4. d4 Bg7 5. Bd3 O-O 6. Nbd2: I think this was not the best move he could have made. In my opinion nc3 would have been better adding pressure to my d5 pawn.
moves.6... Bg4: Just pinning the knight to the queen while developing my bishop.
moves.7. c3: This was a bit passive, he could have easily played c4.
moves.7... c6: defending d5 and also making room for my queen to move.
moves.8. O-O Na6: My plan was to get the knight to c7, but it never got that far
moves.9... Bd7 10. Ne5: now that's a nice knight. One that is hard to get rid of.
moves.10... Be6: Didn't want to give up my lsb, though my opponent probably wasn't going to try and exchange.
moves.11. Bxa6: He volunteers to give up his lsb, which is understandable considering light squares are on a bit of a lockdown. and this also wins a pawn
moves.11... bxa6 12. Nxc6 Qd6 13. Ne5: knight just went back to e5 after snapping that pawn of
moves.14. g4 Ng3 15. Re1: i think he could have played rf3 attacking the knight
moves.16... h5 17. Kg2: This kicks the knight and protects the weak h3 pawn.
moves.17... Ne4 18. gxh5 gxh5: Here i started to feel it will be a race to your opponents king, considering our kings are rather exposed
moves.20. h4 f5: giving room to my queen while supporting my knight.
moves.22. Ne5: the knight is back to where it was.
moves.22... Bxe5: i decided to get rid of it even at the cost of a pawn.
moves.23. fxe5 Qd7 24. Qxh5 f4: opening c8-h3 diagonal for my bishop and queen.
moves.26... dxe4 27. Qxe4: Here i personally like my position, my pieces are alot more active than whites and i have a past f pawn
moves.27... Rfg8+: I saw that i can get a few checks in and decided to see will they lead to something more.
moves.28. Kf2 fxe3+ 29. Bxe3 Raf8+ 30. Ke2 Bg4: just kicking the queen back a bit
moves.32... Qb5 33. Bg5: And this is the massive blunder which allows a mate in two
